block.comment: This script shows how it is possible to 'print' data to a variable. This script also initializes the variables by placing in each 'null'
This script stores the first num in num1, clears the output so the user can enter the 2nd number and it broadcasts a message to the = sprite.
When the = sprite is clicked the the 2nd num is stored into num2 variable and the below is executed.
This script waits until num2 is not null (i.e. the user entered the )

the number sprites 0-9 have a similar script. The script checks if we write the number for the first time onto the output variable. If we do it just adds the relevant character once but if the output variable contains a number already it add the current number with the join block.
When C is clicked this script clears the variables and stores in each 'null'
